comments.author: jirasd-gear-compute-vmi-notifier-ca-montreal-1
comments.body:
_This is comment added by a Jira Automation Workflow (NOT a human being)_

Rules of Engagement for Compute HPC/GPU Support

**Rule 1: Create an incident and choose the right component**
Please create an incident(not service request) for any support request and ensure that you select the appropriate component for accurate assistance.

**Rule 2: No Compute support for GitHub stacks**
We do not provide support for issues related to the GitHub test stacks. Tickets related to those will be closed without further action.
GitHub test stacks repository: [https://github.com/oracle-quickstart/oci-hpc/tree/master/playbooks](https://github.com/oracle-quickstart/oci-hpc/tree/master/playbooks). Reach out to the Solutions Architects in #oci-hpc-int

**Rule 3: Support for Compute HPC Images only**
We offer support exclusively for Compute HPC Images. Please refer to the following link to access the supported Compute HPC Images: [Compute HPC Images](https://objectstorage.eu-frankfurt-1.oraclecloud.com/p/_601lOOXFu5ordAFijwzLPduQ_3To16jFrej0JmxEdz1iKkr2BzqBudhqQ9uikLg/n/hpc/b/exported-compute-hpc-images/o/)

**Rule 4: Provide OCIDs for every issue**
When reporting an issue, please provide the relevant OCIDs (Instance OCIDs, Cluster Network OCIDs) associated with the problem. This information will help us investigate and resolve the issue more effectively.

**Rule 5: Include SOSReports and NVIDIA debug logs for GPU issues**
For GPU-related issues, please include the SOSReports logs and NVIDIA debug logs. These logs are valuable for troubleshooting. Please follow the instructions below to obtain them:
- To collect SOSReports logs, run the command `sudo sosreport`.
- To collect NVIDIA debug logs, execute the command `sudo nvidia-bug-report.sh`.

**Rule 6: Stay positive! We are committed to solving all your problems**
We are here to provide comprehensive support and solve all the challenges you encounter. Stay positive, and we will assist you every step of the way.

comments.author: Imane Barakate
comments.body:
initial setup failed on the host due to a failure while running sudo apt-get update

E: Could not get lock /var/lib/apt/lists/lock. It is held by process 1389851 (apt-get)
E: Unable to lock directory /var/lib/apt/lists/
+ '[' 100 -ne 0 ']'
+ echo 'Failed to apt-get update on ubuntu'
+ writeResults Failed
+ testState=Failed
+ '[' Failed == Success ']'
+ '[' Failed == Detailed ']'

comments.author: Imane Barakate
comments.body:
Tried running sudo apt-get update manually and failed due to an error occurring during the signature verification, the kitware GPG public key was not available

ubuntu@bio-2538xk1050:~/bio/jobs$ sudo apt-get update -y
Get:1 file:/usr/share/doca-host-3.1.0-091000-25.07-ubuntu2204/repo ./ InRelease [1888 B]
Get:1 file:/usr/share/doca-host-3.1.0-091000-25.07-ubuntu2204/repo ./ InRelease [1888 B]
Hit:2 http://us-saltlake-2-ad-1.clouds.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease
Hit:3 http://us-saltlake-2-ad-1.clouds.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates InRelease
Hit:4 https://repo.radeon.com/amdgpu/30.10.2/ubuntu jammy InRelease
Hit:5 http://us-saltlake-2-ad-1.clouds.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-backports InRelease
Get:6 https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease [15.5 kB]
Hit:7 https://repo.radeon.com/rocm/apt/7.0.2 jammy InRelease
Err:6 https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease
  The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 65ADECD7A7039392
Hit:8 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security InRelease
Hit:9 https://repo.radeon.com/graphics/7.0.2/ubuntu jammy InRelease
Fetched 15.5 kB in 1s (23.4 kB/s)
Reading package lists... Done
W: An error occurred during the signature verification. The repository is not updated and the previous index files will be used. GPG error: https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 65ADECD7A7039392
W: Failed to fetch https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu/dists/jammy/InRelease  The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 65ADECD7A7039392
W: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.

comments.author: Imane Barakate
comments.body:
Manually added the Kitware APT GPG key

ubuntu@bio-2538xk1050:~/bio/jobs$ curl -fsSL https://apt.kitware.com/keys/kitware-archive-latest.asc |   gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/kitware.gpg > /dev/null

ubuntu@bio-2538xk1050:~/bio/jobs$ cat /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kitware.list
deb https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu/ jammy main

ubuntu@bio-2538xk1050:~/bio/jobs$ sudo vim /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kitware.list

ubuntu@bio-2538xk1050:~/bio/jobs$ cat /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kitware.list
deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/kitware.gpg] https://apt.kitware.com/ubuntu/ jammy main
